full_summary:
### Advance Procurement Notice Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)

**Contract Title:** Design-Builder Services (MDB Project)

**Government Organization:** Defence Construction Canada - Ontario Region

**Project Description:**

The Canadian Armed Forces Transition Centre (CAF TC) project involves the design, construction, and commissioning of a new facility to accommodate 41 personnel at Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Borden. The scope of work includes a 1,293 m2 gross space facility and an exterior area for 37 civilian vehicles and exterior storage.

**Security Requirements:**

To participate in the procurement process, contractors may be required to hold a valid and active DESIGNATED ORGANIZATION SCREENING (DOS) grant or approval from the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).

**Industrial Security Program (ISP) Sponsorship:**

Defence Construction Canada provides early access to the security clearance application process through sponsorship under its ISP. Constructors and consultants who do not actively hold the required security clearance(s) can apply for sponsorship by submitting a request through the ISP website.

**Tender Information:**

* Estimated design and construction cost: $13,200,000
* Intended solicitation closing date: Summer 2024, conditional on Department of National Defence (DND) approval
* Notice type: Advance Procurement Notice
* Procurement method: Competitive - Open bidding
* Trade agreements: Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), and Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Contracting entity: Defence Construction Canada - Ontario Region

**Contact Information:**

* Cameron King, Regional Service Line Leader, Contracts Services
* 613-483-9587
* Cameron.King@dcc-cdc.gc.ca

**Disclaimer:**

Defence Construction Canada does not guarantee that a sponsorship request package or security clearance application will be successful or result in the granting of the requested security clearance(s) in a timely fashion.

This Advance Procurement Notice is available on the government procurement website at [www.merx.com](http://www.merx.com).
